message.content:
{"id": "24877", 
"title": "Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog", 
"description": "When using the swt FileDialog, we are unable to retrieve the file extension selected by the user. This renders the dialog almost unusable since we cannot determine the correct file extension to append to the file name.", 
"OB": "Currently, there is no API available in the FileDialog to return the 'Save as type' field selected by the user. It is necessary for the FileDialog to provide a method to retrieve this information. Although we have encountered this issue in our own product, it can also be observed when exporting to a JAR file.", 
"EB": "The issue can be reproduced by following these steps: 1) Select a java file, 2) Select File > Export..., 3) Choose JAR file and click Next, 4) Click Browse... to open the Save As file dialog, 5) Enter 'test' for the file name, 6) Select '.zip' for the 'Save as type' field, 7) Click Save. As a result, the JAR export wizard uses 'test' for the JAR file field instead of 'test.zip'. The expected result is that the JAR export wizard should use 'test.zip' for the JAR file field.", 
"SR": "The FileDialog component should be updated to include an API that allows retrieving the 'Save as type' field selected by the user. Additionally, the JAR export wizard should be modified to appropriately handle file extensions when the user selects a file type in the Save As file dialog."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '24877', 'title': 'Bug 24877Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog', 'description': "Bug 24877Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog It makes this dialog almost unusable since we can't determine thecorrect file extension to append to the file name. ", 'OB': 'There\'s no way to get the file extension that the user selected from theFileDialog. We need an api for the filedialog to return the "Save as type" field that the user selected in theFileDialog.Athough we are using this dialog in our own product, this problem can beillustrated when you export to a jar file. ', 'EB': 'The export wizard should use thefile "test.zip" when this happens.STEPS:1) Select a java file2) Select FileExport...3) Select JAR file and press Next4) Press Browse... to select a Save As file dialog5) Enter test for the file name6) Select .zip for the "Save as type" field7) Press SaveResult:The JAR export wizard uses "test" for the JAR file field.Expected result:The JAR export wizard should use the "test.zip" for the JAR file field. ', 'SR': ''}
